degrees: B.S. in Applied Math and Statistics

description: Designed, wrote and tested a visualizer using Angular and ChartJS to visualize business logic and make business impacting decisions.
Tied together various Amazon Web Services in the visualizer to create a “serverless” application.
Utilized AWS Lambda to handle queries that would normally be server-side queries. This allowed the cost of the application to be per usage rather than the cost of the standalone server.
Understood, Assimilated and Thrived in a large software engineering environment where the process for development was already set.
Worked with various experienced engineers to be able to gain an understanding of multiple aspects regarding a problem to then come up with a solution.
Secured return full-time offer

Developed a testbed using C and Qt that automates the capturing of radio frequency (RF) data in a network of various Internet of Things (IoT) devices such as Raspberry Pi, Arduino Modules, LoRa and LoRaWAN.
Utilized tools such as GDB and valgrind to overcome many bugs that were faced in the development process.
Captured and procured data at 50 times the speed in comparison to an older test bed that was being used.
Mastered skills revolving around a Unix development environment while being able to stay on track and consistently meet deadlines.
Implemented a machine learning pipeline to classify between the RF samples and identify which device was transmitting.
Led large group recitation sessions of about 30 people, initiating discussions centered around different data structures
Conducted office hours to tutor peer’s one-on-one and in small groups to assert their understanding which resulted in higher grades
Communicated with the school faculty and met new students daily.

technicalJobs.company: Shah Experimental Neurorehabilitation Laboratory @ Stony Brook
description: Remodeled the Spinal Cord Rehabilitation Research process by developing software using python to automate the process
Designed scripts that used neural EMG pattern recognition techniques for real-time stimulation adjustments for the test subjects.
Used MATLAB to create many scripts which allowed effective data visualization of multiple gigabytes of data.
Contributed to the full stack development process by converting mock-up designs to websites for clients using HTML/CSS/JavaScript.
Implemented efficient ways to manage things such as Physical Identity through RFID systems.

nonTechnicalJobs.company: Half Hollow Hills High School East
description: Utilized Autodesk Inventor to create an accurate representation of the current years robot before commencing production.
Assisted in the mechanical and electrical sides of the final robot production.
Worked with various frameworks and niche pieces of hardware to further develop skills in the IoT.
Elected as the M.V.P for the team at the SBPLI Hofstra regional.
Generated $400,000 in revenue over the span of 5 months of employment and was the number one associate in the PC department
Worked with multiple other associates and kept a strong sense of teamwork to continuously make monthly goals in terms of sales.
Taught students ranging from K to 12 all topics of Math for their level (Kumon Levels A to X).
Focused on specifically tailoring lessons towards individual students based on their learning style.
Occasionally met with students’ parents to introduce new levels and grading methods

nonTechnicalJobs.jobTitle: SASC Course Note Taker (CSE 532 - Theory of Database Systems)
description: Attended lectures and take notes for an unidentified DSS/SASC student needing accommodations.
Organized and timely upload notes to the appropriate location so student could receive them weekly.
Monitored and led the helping of new students moving onto campus while telling them about the campus due to early exposure.

nonTechnicalJobs.company: Theta Tau Professional Co-Ed Engineering Fraternity
description: Oversee the production of all the projects that take place within the fraternity and with other organizations on campus.

projectDetails: Designed, implemented, tested and debugged an application in a team of 4 that can be used for the generation of counties to avoid gerrymandering.
Incorporated various parameters such as political fairness, equal population, demographics, and geographical contiguity to generate objectively fair districts.
Used HTML/CSS/JavaScript for the front end, Java (Spring) for the backend, and MySQL to store the precinct data for the states.
Took use of python to implement a data pipeline that would filter incoming precinct data and place it on the database.
Utilized algorithms such as simulated annealing, graph partitioning, and region growing to generate the districts in multiple ways.
Used C to implement a messaging server hosted on one server that can handle multiple clients connecting to it.
Handled these multiple and concurrent connections using multi-threading and concurrency.
Developed an advanced understanding of POSIX threads while gaining an insight into the design of concurrent data structures.
Used signal processing to influence program control flow and to understand when certain actions occurred throughout the program.
Further developed maneuverability and productivity when working in a UNIX environment.
Recreated a simple implementation of the classic Super Monkey Ball Game using the Unity Game engine.
Integrated the LeapMotion controller with C# to implement hand gestures as the basis for control of the game.
Ended up presenting a hand gesture controller library that posed to control any current game with a set of hand gestures for scalability and ease of use amongst other platforms and games.
Expanded the library to support games like Pong, Guitar Hero, Tetris and more.

projects.projectType: Hack@CEWIT – Best Medical Application Sponsored by Softheon, Inc.
projectDetails: Used Java for the processing and made an app using FXML for the GUI (Repository on GitHub).

Implemented the idea of using image processing captured by a regular webcam which then told the subject standing in front of it if they showed signs of structural scoliosis based on the direction of their spinal activity.
Demonstrated a simple solution that can be easily deployed helping many people around the world.
Designed, implemented, tested and debugged an application that can be used to make Metro Station maps of various cities.
Designed the application using UML class diagrams and dynamic sequence diagrams to initially develop an understanding of the goal.
Implemented using Java, added support for the JSON file format and support for web app usage of said JSON files.
Debugged the application using the debugger built into NetBeans and IntelliJ
